intro: Achyrophorus taraxacoides, commonly known as the yellow starburry, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves that are typically green with a waxy coating. It produces small, spiny fruits called achenes, which are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in open, sunny environments.
